summary: This bill, the "Right to FDA-Approved Medicines Act," aims to protect individuals' access to FDA-approved medications and health care providers' ability to provide them. It establishes a statutory right to obtain these medicines without coercion and restricts limitations on their provision. The bill defines key terms, outlines purposes, specifies permitted services, addresses applicability and preemption of laws, establishes rules of construction, and details enforcement mechanisms, including Attorney General and private rights of action. It also promotes legal challenges to state laws that impede access to these medicines.
